html:
Role Voice type Premiere cast, 6 October 1868,
(Conductor: Jacques Offenbach)[11] 		Revised version, 25 April 1874,
(Conductor: Jacques Offenbach)
La Périchole, a poor street singer mezzo-soprano
Piquillo, a poor street singer tenor
Don Andrès de Ribeira, Viceroy of Peru baritone
Don Miguel de Panatellas, First Gentleman of the Bedchamber tenor
Don Pedro de Hinoyosa, Mayor of Lima baritone
Guadalena, first cousin soprano
Berginella, second cousin soprano
Mastrilla, third cousin mezzo-soprano
The Marquis de Tarapote, Lord Chancellor spoken
Manuelita, lady of the Court soprano
Ninetta, lady of the Court soprano
Brambilla, lady of the Court mezzo-soprano
Frasquinella, lady of the Court mezzo-soprano
First notary tenor
Second notary tenor
First drinker (1868) tenor
Second drinker (1868) tenor
Two men (1868) –
A courtesan (1868) –
A bailiff (1868) –
Le Marquis de Satarem, 'The old prisoner' (1874) spoken
Gaoler (1874) spoken
Chorus: A crowd, drinkers, showmen; Ladies and Lords of the court; soldiers.
